clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Use of Indomethacin as Co-treatment in Women With Preterm Labor and High Risk of Intraamniotic Inflammation
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Utility of Indomethacin as Support Treatment in Women With Preterm Labor With Intact Membranes and High Risk of Intraamniotic Inflammation
clinical_study.source: Fundacion Clinic per a la Recerca Biomédica

brief_summary.textblock: To demonstrate if indomethacin associated to conventional treatment for preterm labor is useful to delay delivery and to improve neonatal morbimortality in women with preterm labor with high risk of intraamniotic inflammation

detailed_description.textblock: Randomised patients would be assigned to receive indomethacin either placebo oral use(50 mg every 6 hours during 5 days) to evaluate the efficacy of indomethacin as complementary treatment to increase the gestational age at delivery in women admitted with preterm labor and intact membranes with high risk of intraamniotic inflammation, defined as a gestational age at admission less than 28.0 weeks or those women from 28-32.0 weeks with a sonographic cervical length less than 15 mm

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: number of weeks and days at delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: proportion of patients with spontaneous preterm delivery before 34 weeks of gestation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of study (maximum 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: the participants will be followed until delivery. The proportion of patiens with spontaneous preterm delivery before week 34 will be available at the end of the study, once the last patient delivers.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between initial admission and delivery (before 42 weeks of gestation)
secondary_outcome.description: Latency from admission to delivery will be calculated

secondary_outcome.measure: IL-6 levels in amniotic fluid and umbilical cord blood
secondary_outcome.description: the investigators will determine the level of IL-6 in different samples

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between initial admission and delivery (before 42 weeks of gestation)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of visits to emergency area will be registered

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the study (1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: neonatal morbidity will be registered: admission to Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) number of days of NICU admission respiratory distress syndrome intraventricular haemorrage early onset neonatal sepsis necrotizing enterocolitis late neonatal sepsis neonatal death.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the study (1 year)

arm_group.description: 50 mg/ 6 hours of indomethacin oral use

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- pregnant women with preterm labor admitted to hospital and treated with tocolysis
- pregnant women less than 28.0 and those women from 28.0 to 32.0 with a sonographic cervical length < 15 mm
- single pregnancy
- normal amniotic fluid
- normal arterial ductus
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age below 18 years
- previous use of indomethacin in the index pregnancy
- chorioamnionitis, preterm prelabour rupture of membranes or those fetal or maternal pathologies which could be responsible of an iatrogenic preterm delivery.
- oligohydramnios
- allergy to NSAID
- previous history of gastrointestinal bleeding
- use of NSAID contraindicated
- not adherence to the study
